feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The student demonstrates a working financial application: programmatic real-time data fetching (yfinance), AI-driven valuation and risk outputs, and a live demo analyzing Microsoft. Implementation and verification evidence shows the tool performs concrete financial tasks, meeting the criterion.
- Integrate AI: The student shows concrete, effective AI integration: programmatic real-time data ingestion to reduce hallucination, explicit prompt engineering to produce structured investment analyses, and a working Replet demo of the AI's outputs. These demonstrate depth and practical application beyond a superficial use, meeting the PASS standard.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "I click um analyze stock and you can see that it was able to fetch the data from Y Finance um of what the Microsoft Corporation's current price looks like, the PE ratio, plus a more in-depth analysis of um Micros of Microsoft's details."
"if you look here at the code, I used Y finance and I imported it as YIF."

"I'm injecting that real-time data into the prompt and instructing the AI to act specifically like a value investor. I forced it to give me a structured output, a business model summary, a valuation analysis, and specific risks."
criteria.driver_alignment: Implement (wrote Python, integrated yfinance, deployed in Replet) and Verify (uses real-time market data to prevent hallucination and shows live example with Microsoft) primarily support the evaluation; Discover (identified need for contextualized finance tools) and Reflect (disclaimer/ethics) further corroborate intent and completeness.
criteria.reasoning: The student demonstrates a working financial application: programmatic real-time data fetching (yfinance), AI-driven valuation and risk outputs, and a live demo analyzing Microsoft. Implementation and verification evidence shows the tool performs concrete financial tasks, meeting the criterion.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "First was external data integration. So if you look here at the code, I used Y finance and I imported it as YIF. So I'm not really asking the AI to guess stock prices. I am programmatically fetching real-time market data. So this really prevents hallucinations from the AI."
"So, I wanted to build a tool that uses AI to provide that context."

"I'm injecting that real-time data into the prompt and instructing the AI to act specifically like a value investor. I forced it to give me a structured output, a business model summary, a valuation analysis, and specific risks."
criteria.driver_alignment:
- Discover: identified the need for AI to provide contextual explanations for financial metrics.
- Implement: integrated YFinance, Gemini API, prompt engineering, and deployed the tool in Replet.
- Reflect/Verify: demonstrated the app fetching real-time data, producing structured analyses, and discussed prompt tuning and ethical disclaimers.
criteria.reasoning: The student shows concrete, effective AI integration: programmatic real-time data ingestion to reduce hallucination, explicit prompt engineering to produce structured investment analyses, and a working Replet demo of the AI's outputs. These demonstrate depth and practical application beyond a superficial use, meeting the PASS standard.
